intro: Pseuderanthemum stenosiphon, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false anthemum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, narrow elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with two lips resembling those of true anthemums. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species within its native habitat.
